title: Fake stamps, diplomatic license plates: How a man ran fake embassy for 'West Arctica' from Ghaziabad
content: In Ghaziabad, a man named Harsh Vardhan Jain was arrested for operating a fake embassy from a rented house. Posing as a diplomat from the fictitious nation of "West Arctica," he allegedly defrauded individuals and businesses with promises of overseas jobs. Jain enhanced his credibility using doctored images with prominent Indian leaders and fake diplomatic plates.

title: Epstein fallout: Trump invokes 'favourite saviour' - Obama. Will MAGA buy it?
content: Donald Trump faces heat over Jeffrey Epstein links. He accuses Barack Obama of treason to deflect attention. However, this tactic seems less effective now. MAGA supporters demand more disclosures. The Epstein scandal divides Trump's base. Some Republicans use the issue against Trump. His grip on MAGA weakens. The old playbook may not work this time.

title: 'Had strong pro-China stance': Ex-President Nasheed on India-Maldives ties
content: Former Maldives President Mohamed Nasheed affirmed the nation's commitment to an "India-first foreign policy," highlighting past fluctuations between pro-China and pro-India stances. He lauded India's crucial economic assistance, which prevented a default, and anticipates Prime Minister Modi's upcoming visit will boost tourism. Modi's visit occurs amidst improving relations following a diplomatic row earlier in 2024.

title: ‘The only right answer is…’: Bill Gates on daughter’s unexpected ask
content: Bill Gates, the Microsoft co-founder, recently took on a customer service role at Phia, his daughter Phoebe's AI-powered fashion startup. Phoebe and her co-founder Sophia Kianni developed Phia, a platform that helps users compare prices across numerous online retailers. Gates emphasized the importance of directly engaging with users to understand a product's functionality and potential issues.

title: CBSE warns schools: No more than 45 students per section—no exceptions
content: CBSE has announced that affiliated schools can now register up to 45 students per section under exceptional circumstances, as outlined in Circular No. 11/2025. This decision addresses challenges in accommodating students, especially transfers, and builds upon previous relaxations introduced in August 2023 and May 2024. Schools must document reasons and ensure adequate classroom sizes.

title: IND vs ENG: After nearly 3,000 days, Dawson returns to Tests in style - Watch
content: Liam Dawson marked a sensational Test return after 2,928 days, immediately impacting the India vs England series by claiming Yashasvi Jaiswal as his first wicket in eight years. His beautifully flighted delivery showcased his evolved bowling skills, earning praise from Ravichandran Ashwin. Dawson's comeback adds depth to England's attack, reigniting their fight and inspiring fans with his perseverance.

title: 'No phones or laptops': BlackRock’s strict travel rule for staff; tech in China trips
content: BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, has restricted employee device usage in China due to rising US-China tensions. Staff must now use temporary phones and cannot use company laptops. This policy enhancement, effective July 16, reflects growing corporate anxiety after incidents involving Western executives being prevented from leaving China.

title: ‘You can’t change colours’: Indian student attacked in racist assault in Australia
content: An Indian international student, Charanpreet Singh, was brutally assaulted in Adelaide, with the attack being investigated as potentially racially motivated. Singh and his wife were allegedly ambushed by a group of men who shouted racial slurs before inflicting serious injuries. The incident has sparked outrage and renewed calls for enhanced safety measures for international students in the area.

title: Travis Kelce watches as Jason goes shirtless in front of Taylor Swift during NFL game
content: Jason Kelce, the former Philadelphia Eagles center, had a memorable day at a Kansas City Chiefs playoff game. He was there to support his brother, Travis Kelce. Jason met pop star Taylor Swift in Travis's suite. He got so excited that he took his shirt off and jumped into the stands.

title: Electronics exports: India challenges China’s dominance, eyes leadership in manufacturing
content: India is poised to become a major electronics manufacturing hub, challenging China and Vietnam, according to a Centre for Development Studies report. The Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme spurred a massive increase in mobile phone exports, reaching $24.1 billion in 2024-25. Domestic Value Addition also rose significantly, creating numerous jobs.

title: Who is Bryan Johnson: Anti-aging champion who spent $2 million on age-reversing
content: Bryan Johnson, the tech entrepreneur known for his anti-aging pursuits, is discontinuing his age-reversal startup, Blueprint, citing financial losses and a desire to concentrate on his philosophical movement, "Don't Die." Johnson, famous for his intense health regimen, aims to fully dedicate himself to this new mission, viewing commercial ventures as distractions from his goal of reshaping humanity's relationship with death.

title: 'I married Ishita, but she was Afreen': UP man alleges forced conversion bid by Chhangur Baba
content: Jyotirgmay Rai accused Chhangur Baba, also known as Jamaluddin, of brainwashing him and threatening to kill his two daughters to force his conversion to Islam. Rai alleges that after marrying a Muslim woman and having children, he faced immense pressure to convert, including threats involving his daughters. Police are investigating the claims following Rai's complaint.

title: Ozzy Osbourne (1948–2025) – the bat-biting godfather of metal signs off in style
content: Ozzy Osbourne, the Prince of Darkness, lived louder than the amplifiers he fronted. From Birmingham’s grimy streets, he forged heavy metal with Black Sabbath’s doom-laden riffs, reshaping rock forever. His voice – raw, haunted, unforgettable – became the soundtrack of rebellion and existential dread. Offstage, he was chaos incarnate: biting bats, snorting ants, and turning scandal into legend. Fired by Sabbath, he returned with Crazy Train, proving he was both survivor and showman. His final concert at Villa Park, days before his death at 76, was a thunderous farewell. Ozzy didn’t just live rock ‘n’ roll – he weaponised it.

title: ‘Hurts Islamic sentiments’: BJP slams Dimple Yadav’s attire at mosque; Akhilesh fires back
content: The BJP has strongly criticized Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav for conducting a party meeting inside a mosque on Parliament Street, alleging that Dimple Yadav's attire violated mosque norms and hurt Islamic sentiments. Dimple Yadav refuted the claims, accusing the BJP of misleading the public, while Akhilesh Yadav slammed the BJP for using religion as a divisive tool.

title: Bihar voter list revision: 20L deceased, over 7L duplicate voters - EC gives update on SIR
content: The Election Commission's intensive revision of Bihar's electoral rolls has covered 98.01% of voters, identifying deceased, migrated, and duplicate entries. This cleanup, the first in 22 years, aims to ensure a pure and accurate voter list. The Supreme Court and opposition parties are scrutinising the exercise, while the EC defends its legality and limited use of identity documents.

title: 'Can't express ...': How Kamboj spent his last 48 hours before India Test debut - Watch
content: Anshul Kamboj, Haryana's seamer, debuts for India in the fourth Test against England at Old Trafford. He receives his cap from Deep Dasgupta. Kamboj expresses his feelings as unreal. He aims to perform his best. Kamboj's inclusion follows impressive performances for India A. He shares a connection with Anil Kumble, who debuted in Manchester in 1990.

title: IndiGo Ahmedabad-Diu flight aborts take-off; engine fire warning issued
content: An IndiGo ATR flight 6E-7966, en route from Ahmedabad to Diu, experienced an engine fire warning during takeoff on Wednesday, prompting the pilots to abort. The aircraft, carrying 70 passengers, halted safely, and all individuals on board are reported to be secure. The aircraft is currently grounded for thorough inspections, and the DGCA has initiated an investigation into the incident.

title: Dwyane Wade’s wife Gabrielle Union says surrogacy felt like public humiliation
content: Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union faced significant challenges in starting a family. Union recently shared her emotional struggles with Marie Claire, revealing that miscarriages and the subsequent surrogacy journey took a toll on her mental health. She described the experience as feeling like a "f---ing public humiliation" when it didn't go as planned.

title: Watch: Jaiswal breaks bat in dramatic fashion! India reach lunch unscathed
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's bat handle dramatically snapped while facing Chris Woakes during the fourth Test's opening session at Old Trafford. Despite the equipment malfunction, the young opener remained composed, contributing to India's steady start. At lunch, India reached 78/0, with Jaiswal and KL Rahul blunting the English attack, frustrating the bowlers who struggled to find consistency under overcast conditions.

title: Michael Beasley shares heartwarming childhood pictures of his kids
content: Michael Beasley showcases his role as a loving father on Instagram. He shares heartwarming pictures of his children. Beasley co-founded WeThemOnes, a streetwear brand. The brand released an exclusive collection in February. Beasley also won a $100,000 challenge against Lance Stephenson. He addressed his basketball skills on a podcast. Beasley's net worth is $10 million.

title: ‘Aggressive US pressure can force…’: GTRI warns India against one-sided trade deal
content: The Global Trade Research Initiative (GTRI) warns India against replicating the US-Indonesia trade deal, which heavily favors the US by granting access to Indonesia's markets while imposing tariffs on Indonesian goods. GTRI advises India to be cautious in trade negotiations with the US, especially regarding agriculture, digital trade, and product standards.

title: Kranti Goud: Daughter of a MP police constable, who rocked England with 6/52
content: Kranti Goud, a 21-year-old pace sensation from a small village in Madhya Pradesh, delivered a match-winning performance for India, claiming 6 for 52 against England. Her journey from humble beginnings, supported by her coach Rajiv Bilthare and later Chandrakant Pandit, culminated in a series-clinching victory.

title: ED files case against Myntra over Rs 1,654 crore FDI violation; company responds
content: The Enforcement Directorate has filed a complaint under Fema against Myntra, its entities, and directors for alleged FDI violations worth Rs 1,654.35 crore, accusing the company of misusing the wholesale trade route for multi-brand retail. Myntra, a Walmart unit, responded saying it has not received the complaint or documents and remains committed to cooperating with authorities.

title: IND vs ENG: Shocking! England’s tailenders have more runs than India’s top 4
content: Ahead of the Manchester Test, a surprising statistic reveals England's lower-order batsmen—Liam Dawson, Chris Woakes, Brydon Carse, and Jofra Archer—possess more combined first-class runs than India's top four. This highlights England's batting depth, contrasting with India's less experienced top order. As England leads the series 2-1, their strong lower order could be pivotal.

title: Rajya Sabha to hold discussion on Pahalgam attack on Tuesday; 16-hour session planned
content: Rajya Sabha will hold a 16-hour discussion on the Pahalgam attack and Operation Sindoor next Tuesday. This follows two days of disruptions due to Opposition protests. Opposition MPs demanded an immediate debate, leading to multiple adjournments. The House faced repeated disruptions as members insisted on addressing the SIR issue first. Several notices for discussions were rejected, adding to the tension.

title: Supermodel who made his debut with Sridevi changed his name, here's why
content: Deepak Malhotra's Bollywood dream, launched by Yash Chopra's 'Lamhe' alongside Sridevi, turned sour due to a single scene and the repetitive utterance of "Pallo." The backlash derailed his career, costing him roles in films like 'Chamatkar' and 'Darr.

title: Infosys Q1 results: IT giant posts net profit of Rs 6,921 crore, up 9% YoY
content: Infosys reported a 9% YoY increase in consolidated net profit, reaching Rs 6,921 crore for Q1, with revenue up 8% to Rs 42,279 crore. The company has revised its revenue growth guidance upward, projecting 1-3% growth in constant currency for FY26. Despite a slight dip in operating margin, Infosys secured significant deals and maintained strong cash flow.

title: IND vs ENG : Kamboj turns ailing father's faith into India Test cap: 'Beta tappa...'
content: Anshul Kamboj has taken a long road to live his ultimate dream, playing Test cricket for India. The 24-year-old was one of the favourites to be picked for the England tour but narrowly missed out. Last week, he was drafted into the Indian squad for the fourth Test against England in Manchester after injuries to all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy and the pace duo of Akash Deep and Arshdeep Singh. Now, he is set to make his Test debut at Old Trafford.

title: Dhankhar Dhamaka: Election for VP must be held ‘ASAP’ in event of a vacancy
content: The election to the vice-president's office must occur promptly upon a vacancy, or before the incumbent's term expires. The electoral college, comprising Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha members, elects the vice-president through proportional representation using a single transferable vote. The Election Commission oversees the process, with MPs voting by secret ballot and political parties unable to issue whips.

title: 'Friends' star Matthew Perry's doctor to plead guilty
content: Dr. Salvador Palensia, Matthew Perry's doctor, is expected to plead guilty to illegally providing Ketamine to the actor before his fatal overdose in 2023. He will admit guilt on four counts of Ketamine distribution, with other charges dropped. Palensia's attorneys claim he wasn't treating Perry at the time of death, nor did he provide the lethal dose.

title: Air India crash: British victims' families receive wrong bodies
content: Families of British victims from the Air India crash are facing further anguish as some received misidentified remains. Errors came to light during DNA verification, leading to cancelled funerals and the discovery of "commingled" remains. Authorities are urged to provide explanations for the distress caused by these mistakes, which compound the tragedy of the fatal crash.

title: ‘Saiyaara’ box office collection day 6: Mohit Suri's film inches towards Rs 150 crore club
content: Mohit Suri's directorial 'Saiyaara,' starring newcomers Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, has become an unexpected box office success. The film recorded the highest opening day for newcomers and continued its strong performance, earning Rs 83 crore in its first weekend, a record for a love story.

title: IND vs ENG Test: Gill loses another toss, India's wait gets longer
content: India's coin toss woes continued as Shubman Gill lost his fourth consecutive toss, marking 14 straight losses across formats since January. Despite this, Gill remained optimistic, citing favourable batting conditions and highlighting India's strong performance in previous Tests. England chose to bowl after winning the toss. Debutant Anshul Kamboj joined Anil Kumble in a rare red-ball feat.

title: Landslide in Rajasthan village: Hill breaks apart with explosion-like roar
content: A significant landslide struck near Nari village in Rajasthan's Chirawa region early Wednesday, following the collapse of a hill section. Villagers attribute the incident to alleged illegal blasting by mining contractors, exacerbated by recent heavy rainfall. While no casualties were reported, the event triggered panic and claims of structural damage to a nearby school.

title: Russia oil sanctions hit: Traders, shippers avoid Nayara Energy India
content: Global shipping firms and petroleum traders are reportedly avoiding Nayara Energy, an Indian refiner, following recent EU sanctions linked to its significant stakeholder, Rosneft. Several vessels, including the Talara and Chang Hang Xing Yun, have altered course or cancelled bookings with Nayara.

title: 'Thanks for filthy drinking water': Jaipur residents name potholes after MLAs
content: People in Jaipur are finding creative ways to protest civic problems. Residents of Shiv Vihar Colony put up posters criticizing their MLA, Gopal Sharma, for failing to fix contaminated water issues. Elsewhere, citizens are naming potholes after MLAs in areas like Hawa Mahal and Malviya Nagar. This is a symbolic way to show their disappointment.

title: Harassed for days: UP schoolgirl thrashes accused in public- video
content: In Uttar Pradesh's Unnao, a schoolgirl bravely confronted and thrashed a man, Akash, who allegedly harassed her during her daily commute. A viral video captured the girl fearlessly slapping and hitting the accused with a brick. Bystanders intervened, handing Akash over to the police.

title: Who is Ben Askren’s wife? Ex-UFC star’s spouse warns fans of scam accounts
content: Amy Askren, wife of Ben Askren, alerted fans about scam accounts exploiting Ben's recent double lung transplant. These fake profiles were soliciting money under her name, prompting Amy to warn followers on social media. She emphasized that she would never request donations through personal accounts and urged fans to report any imposters, directing them to verified sources for legitimate support.

title: ‘Imposed forcefully’: JDU MP slams SIR in Bihar
content: Janata Dal (United) MP Giridhari Yadav has criticized the Election Commission's Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Bihar, deeming it rushed and impractical. Opposition parties, including Congress and Samajwadi Party, have protested the SIR, alleging voter suppression and disrupting Parliament. The Election Commission defends the revision as essential for accurate electoral rolls, citing deceased, shifted, and duplicate voters.

title: Three T.N. woman arrested in Idukki for attempt to sell 139 rose-ringed parakeets
content: They arrived early morning on Wednesday by bus from Pollachi in Tamil Nadu to Kattappana in Idukki carrying 139 birds hidden in cages

title: Tiruchi, Ariyalur police get ready for PM’s visit on July 27
content: Advanced Security Liaison meetings held in Tiruchi on Wednesday ahead of the VVIP’s visit to Gangaikondacholapuram in Ariyalur district

title: Munnar, Pengal Otrumai fondly remembers V.S. Achuthanandan
content: Workers from the tea plantations converge in Munnar town on July 23 to mourn the passing of their beloved leader

title: After 5 years, India to issue visas to Chinese tourists
content: The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs termed the decision a “positive move”; it, however, brushed aside concerns over the dam across the Yarlung Sangpo saying it was “fully within China’s sovereignty” and that it was cooperating with countries downstream

title: Two days before Bihar SIR deadline, 15 lakh yet to submit enumeration forms, one lakh untraceable: ECI
content: Over 98% voters covered by SIR; 20 lakh have died, 28 lakh migrated permanently; those who have temporarily moved out of the State can fill in the form online or send it to their BLO; dfraft roll to be published on August 1

title: DYFI demands rollback of ticket price hike for Hari Hara Veera Mallu
content: They term it outrageous to charge ₹700 to ₹1,000 for benefit shows held a day before the film’s official release

title: Man, son brutally hacked to death in Bapatla district
content: The deceased, residents of Channasandra in Karnataka, were found murdered at a real estate venture near Pathamaguluru village; police suspect a premeditated attack, investigation underway

title: Integration of labour, industrial and national interest is a challenge in age of technological transformation, says Mohan Bhagwat
content: Speaking at an event on the 70th anniversary of Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh (BMS), Mr. Bhagwat says equality among the workforce will not be achieved until people rise above the interests of their own families

title: Alnavar, Annigeri taluk hospitals to be upgraded with 30 beds
content: The government hospitals in the two taluks of Dharwad district will be made community health centres, says Health Minister

title: Heavy security in place in Thrissur for Karkidaka Vavu Bali ceremonies
content: Over 500 police personnel deployed across 87 locations; scuba diving and rescue teams, ambulances, and emergency response units will be stationed at all major venues

title: Tamil Nadu government officials acting like DMK’s propaganda secretaries, says BJP leader
content: Taking a dig at the DMK for involving government officials in Ungaludan Stalin programme, Nainar Nagenthran says the DMK is expanding itself at the cost of taxpayer’s money

title: Man gets life sentence for sexual assault of minor boy in Irinjalakuda
content: 63-year-old convict imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh and sentenced to an additional 13 years of imprisonment

title: IndiGo's Ahmedabad-Diu flight aborts take-off due to technical snag
content: The aircraft was in the take-off roll phase when the pilot decided to stop it on the runway; All the 50-odd passengers and crew members are safe, airlines says

title: BJP accuses Samajwadi Party of holding ‘political meeting’ at a mosque; SP refutes the charge
content: BJP leaders shared a photograph of Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav, his wife and MP Dimple Yadav, party MP Mohibulla Nadvi, who is also Imam of the mosque, and others sitting in the mosque

title: State govt. is committed to ensuring the welfare of unorganised workers, says Lad
content: The Labour Minister says the State government is implementing various schemes providing social security to improve their living standards

title: Sharmila slams NDA govt. in Andhra Pradesh for ‘abandoning’ Aadabidda Nidhi scheme
content: A monthly financial assistance of ₹1,500 to all eligible women aged between 18 and 59 has been promised under the ‘Super Six’ scheme

title: Passan's ultimate MLB trade deadline preview: Where all 30 teams stand, best fits and latest intel
content: From the contenders to the rebuilders, here's what every front office is thinking ahead of the July 31 deadline.

title: Wilson is Giants' starting QB, coach Daboll says
content: Russell Wilson is the clear-cut starting quarterback as the Giants begin training camp, coach Brian Daboll said Wednesday.

title: FSU QB Castellanos standing firm on Bama jab
content: New Florida State QB Tommy Castellanos, who took a perceived shot at Alabama, the Seminoles' Week 1 opponent, says he meant 'no disrespect' to the Tide but stands on his comments.

title: Terps' Locksley: Lost locker room amid pay divide
content: Maryland coach Mike Locksley admitted Tuesday he "lost" the locker room in 2024 over which players to compensate.

title: Ohio State prioritized 3-way QB battle over portal
content: Ohio State coach Ryan Day said he didn't add a transfer portal QB this offseason because he wanted to develop the three passers the Buckeyes have on campus.

title: 'Rock bottom': Dodgers bullpen implodes again
content: The Dodgers have long been expected to target bullpen help ahead of the trade deadline, which is now eight days away, but the urgency has ratcheted up after another bullpen implosion.

title: Raiders reunite ex-Pro Bowler Adams with Carroll
content: The Raiders signed three-time Pro Bowl safety Jamal Adams, reuniting him with coach Pete Carroll, whom he played under in Seattle.

title: Sources: Saints eye Blackmon to replace Mathieu
content: Following Tyrann Mathieu's retirement, the Saints are working to sign Julian Blackmon, one of the top safeties available, sources told ESPN.

title: 😬 NBA's biggest roster mistakes since 2020
content: Zach Kram examines the deals, trades and picks that all 30 NBA teams would like to take back from the 2020s.

title: "If he failed, their process failed": Inside the NFLPA meltdown
content: Players are looking to learn from the mistakes that led them to hire ex-NFLPA executive director Lloyd Howell Jr.

title: NBA rebuild rankings: How close 14 teams are to title contention
content: Is Dallas' rebuild already complete? How close is San Antonio? We examine the paths forward for 14 teams that missed the playoffs.

title: How the Valkyries have exceeded all expectations -- even their own
content: Expansion franchises have historically struggled in Year 1. But Golden State is fighting for a WNBA playoff spot.

title: We ranked the 50 most impactful NFL offseason moves, from Davante Adams to Russell Wilson
content: Which offseason acquisitions and draft picks will have the most impact at their new destinations in Year 1? Matt Bowen ranks the top 50.

title: Odunze, McCarthy among favorite breakouts for 2025
content: Which players can you count on to break out in 2025? Our experts go around the league and identify six that stand out.

title: Spain finally have all of Barcelona's midfield stars in top form together
content: Alexia Putellas, Aitana Bonmatí and Patri Guijarro have been unable to combine for Spain as they do for Barcelona. At Euro 2025, that is changing.

title: Berger typifies Germany's fight as tough semifinal looms
content: Germany needed their goalkeeper at her best vs. France and will need her again to star again to beat Spain.

title: Manchester United's U.S. preseason tour: Amorim's goals, players to watch
content: Manchester United and Ruben Amorim have arrived in the U.S. aiming to lay the groundwork for a rebound after a dismal 2024-25 campaign.

title: USMNT prospect Wiley sent on loan to Watford
content: American defender Caleb Wiley was again sent on loan from Chelsea to second-tier Watford on Tuesday after spending the second half of last season with the Hornets.

title: Zubimendi: Liverpool move wasn't at 'right time'
content: Martín Zubimendi has said he turned down Liverpool last summer because "it wasn't the right time" to leave Real Sociedad.

title: Sources: Arsenal remain close to Gyökeres deal
content: Arsenal are edging closer to a deal worth in the region of €73 million ($86m) for Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyökeres, sources have told ESPN.

title: Fabregas: 'Never say never' on Messi, Como move
content: Como boss Cesc Fabregas has said Lionel Messi is happy in U.S but hasn't ruled out the possibility of his former Barcelona teammate signing for the Italian club one day.

title: Source: Leverkusen, Juve chase Chelsea's Sterling
content: Juventus and Bayer Leverkusen are among the clubs interested in Chelsea winger Raheem Sterling, a source has told ESPN.

title: Source: Mbappé to take No. 10 jersey at Madrid
content: Kylian Mbappé will wear the No. 10 jersey at Real Madrid next season, switching from the No. 9 he wore last year, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: MLS All-Star coach hopeful missing Messi plays
content: The 2025 MLS All-Star Game in Austin, Texas, was supposed to be the first featuring Lionel Messi after injury kept him out of the 2024 event. That appeared less likely following Monday's first training session.

title: Jota's wife posts tribute on wedding anniversary
content: The wife of the late Liverpool forward Diogo Jota has posted a "forever" message on social media on what would have been their first month wedding anniversary.

title: Think like an injury expert: What to expect from Ohtani's return to the rotation
content: Shohei Ohtani has ramped up his workload since making his pitching debut as a Dodger back on June 16, but what can we expect out of him for the rest of the season?

title: Scheffler's dominance, players to watch and how the Ryder Cup teams look
content: What's next for Scottie Scheffler? Who are the locks for Bethpage, and who has work to do? Following The Open, we look ahead to the rest of the 2025 golf season.

title: Best of the rest: Who's left in NHL free agency?
content: Most of the NHL free agent deals are handed out July 1. But there are still some players left -- here are the top remaining unrestricted free agents.

title: Betting buzz: Dallas Cowboys' season win total lowest since 2003
content: The Cowboys' win total for this season has dropped to 7.5 at ESPN BET, the lowest preseason win total for a Cowboys team since 2003.

title: Jets go high-tech (and old school) with locker room redesign
content: A barbershop, along with customized video screens and lockers give the Jets' new locker room a modern-meets-retro feel.

title: Petitti letter: Michigan sign-stealing penalties have gone far enough
content: Despite charges of serious NCAA rule violations, commissioner indicates sanctions have run their course

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including the CP3-Clippers reunion
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: Buyer beware: The gamble MLS clubs make with designated players
content: The opening of the transfer window on Thursday offers a reminder that signing a big-name player simply won't cut it in MLS these days.

title: England's late show stuns Italy as super-subs seal final spot
content: England's super-subs saved the day with minutes to go against Italy as the Lionesses snuck into the Euro 2025 final.

title: Preview, times, predictions, stats and fun facts
content: Formula 1 heads to Spa-Francorchamps for round 13 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the weekend.

title: Tom Aspinall booked his first title defense, but is it the right matchup?
content: The UFC 320 and UFC 321 headliners have been announced. Brett Okamoto reacts to the three upcoming title fights.

title: Pound for pound: Shakur, 'Bam' Rodriguez move up after exciting wins
content: Oleksandr Usyk is still No. 1, but where do Shakur Stevenson and Jesse Rodriguez land? Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: Divisional: Pacquiao reenters welterweight top 10
content: Manny Pacquiao reclaims a spot in the welterweight rankings. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: CMRL-Exalogic case: Kerala High Court issues notice to Veena, 12 others
content: Notice issued on a petition filed by BJP leader Shone George, seeking a Central Bureau of Investigation probe into allegations pertaining to financial transactions between CMRL, Exalogic

title: Response to ‘Suparipalanalo Tholi Adugu’ positive, says Andhra Pradesh Labour Minister Subhash
content: The State has attracted investments worth ₹6 lakh crore, laying the foundation for 10 lakh job opportunities, says Labour Minister Vasamsetty Subhash

title: FGG for V&E probe into ‘misuse’ of special development funds
content: Forum president Padmanabha Reddy addresses letter to Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy citing instances

title: RCU professor suspended for sexual, mental harassment of research student in Vijayapura
content: This order follows a report by the Internal Grievances Redressal Committee after a complaint by the student against her research guide

title: ‘Grave error’: Why Bombay HC acquitted all 12 convicted in 2006 Mumbai train blasts
content: The High Court held that the Anti-Terrorism Squad’s case relied on confessions extracted through torture and unreliable witness testimonies

title: IIT-Tiruchi, NIT-Puducherry, and Central varsity of T.N. chosen for collaborative research project with IIT-M
content: An initial grant of ₹2.3 crore has been sanctioned for one year of collaborative activities under the Anusandhan National Research Foundation-Partnerships for Accelerated Innovation and Research (ANRF-PAIR) programme

title: Four kanwariyas killed as speeding car hits group of devotees in M.P.’s Gwalior
content: The devotees were returning from a monsoon waterfall near a Lord Shiva temple in a neighbouring area to their home in Gwalior district when the accident took place; CM announces ex gratia to next of kin

title: Officials told to release HNSS waters into Gajuladinne project
content: Kurnool Collector directs engineers to carefully utilise the inflows into the Krishnagiri reservoir, Pattikonda reservoir and provide waters to all the ayacut farmers

title: Goa CM’s statement on Mahadayi project is shocking, says H.K. Patil
content: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant reportedly made a statement in the Legislative Assembly that Union Minister for Environment and Forests Bhupendra Yadav informed him that the Central government will not approve the Mahadayi project

title: Special squad nabs two Kozhikode natives in digital arrest scam
content: The two youths, pretending as enforcement officers, reportedly collected ₹18.15 lakh in different instalments from an elderly couple in the name of settling a money laundering case

title: Parliamentary proceedings: In five years, 295% rise in the number of people seeking de-addiction treatment, govt. data shows
content: De-addiction centres supported by the Centre treated 2.08 lakh people in 2020-21; this number rose to over 8.23 lakh in 2024-25

title: Setting a clear goal, confidence will simplify the path to success, students told
content: Police Commissioner inaugurates a felicitation programme organised by Gurudev IAS, KAS and Banking Academy in Dharwad

title: Over 3,400 SHGs formed to empower de-notified, nomadic communities, Rajya Sabha told
content: The information was told in a written reply in the Rajya Sabha, by the Minister of State for Social Justice and Empowerment B. L. Verma

title: State continues to depend on financial accommodation instruments to meet its needs
content: SDF utilised on all days of April and May and funds mobilised through WMA for most part of two months

title: Construction of LuLu mega shopping mall in Visakhapatnam will begin soon, says its CMD Yousuff Ali
content: It will provide employment to 5,000 to 8,000 persons, he says, adding that the company will soon start a food processing plant and hypermarket in Vijayawada

title: Coast Guard gets pollution control vessel to counter oil spills
content: The Ministry of Defence said that with 72% indigenous components, the project boosts national capability, jobs, and skills through local industry and MSME involvement

title: Speed up flyover works, set up warning signboards at all accident zones along NH-40, says Chittoor Collector
content: According to officials, as many as 14 casualties have been reported from the Nandimangalam and MCR  flyover and roadworks, in addition to critical injuries to 46 workers in the last five years due to lack of safety precautions

title: 14,000 government schools in Karnataka lack land records
content: The Department of School Education and Literacy has launched a campaign to obtain land records within three months

title: Report on Vision Plan 2031 by mid-December
content: State Policy and Planning Commission to complete formulating a human development and sustainable district development plan before that

title: TGSRTC rumbles past 200 crore free trips milestone
content: According to official data, the State government has so far reimbursed ₹6,680 crore based on the trips taken by women passengers under the Mahalaxmi Scheme even as daily ridership recorded an increase of 24% rising from 45.49 lakh to 60.08 lakh

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: State Election Commission publishes draft electoral rolls in the run-up to 2025 local body polls in Kerala
content: The final list will be published on August 30. The draft can be accessed on the commission’s website sec.kerala.gov.in, and village and taluk offices.

title: Eluru District Collector instructs officials to identify and admit school dropouts, particularly girls, by July 25
content: Joint teams to conduct field visits; officials told to submit zero-dropout resolutions at village, mandal level

title: Mandaviya introduces sports governance bill for greater transparency in NSFs, including BCCI
content: All recognised national sports bodies would also come under the ambit of the Right to Information (RTI) Act, something that the BCCI has vehemently opposed

title: TG committed to mobilise MPs’ support for enhanced quota to BCs: CM
content: Revanth Reddy asks BJP to scrap reservations for Muslims in Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh and Maharashtra before advising Telangana

title: Step up surveillance to curb drug trafficking: Sri Sathya Sai Collector
content: Supply networks which target students and workers in the transport sector must be identified and eliminated through joint operations, says T.S. Chetan

title: Cancel Madurai Adheenam’s anticipatory bail, police urge Madras High Court
content: Says, he is not cooperating with the investigation in a case booked against him for making false statements intended at promoting communal enmity

title: Nearly 37% children under five stunted, govt data shows
content: In response to a question in Rajya Sabha, Minister of State for Women and Child Development Savitri Thakur said Uttar Pradesh reported the highest rate of stunting at 48.83 per cent

title: Union Petroleum Minister promises ₹48 crore for cancer treatment equipment in three government general hospitals in Andhra Pradesh
content: Each hospital will get equipment worth ₹16 crore from the ONGC through its Corporate Social Responsibility fund, says Rajya Sabha member Sathish Babu

title: Bapatla District Collector bans Black Burley tobacco cultivation for this year
content: He cites heavy farmer losses, warns of strict action against violations; urges shift to alternative crops

title: L&T Metro Rail Hyderabad records 25% growth in ridership; revenue drops by 21%
content: Of the ₹1,108.54 crore revenue in the financial year of 2024-25, ₹627.11 crore is from fare collection through the metro rail system

title: Karnataka tech ecosystem sees funding drop, Bengaluru fares better: Report
content: Bengaluru-based tech firms accounted for the majority of the funding raised by tech companies across Karnataka

title: Bengaluru bomb scare: Detonators found outside BMTC bus stand toilet; probe on
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the toi News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape .

title: India resumes tourist visas for Chinese: First time since 2020 border clash; Beijing welcomes move
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: 'Can be discussed': Tejashwi on possibility of Bihar poll boycott over SIR exercise
content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . the toi news desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide .

title: Iran confronts US destroyer in Gulf of Oman; vessel 'forced to retreat'
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . read more 10 baby girl names that mean "bright" 7 places where you can see the endangered red pandas in india 10 poignant quotes from Shakespeare's Othello 8 beautiful creepers for your balcony Bal Gangadhar Tilak’s 169th birth anniversary .

title: Delhi's Big Request To Haryana For Better Flood Management
content: The Delhi government will formally request Haryana to hand over control of the Indraprastha Barrage on the Yamuna River to improve the city's flood management, senior officials said on Wednesday.

title: From Spy Cockroaches To AI Robots: Germany Start-Up Plots Future Of Warfare
content: The former partner at McKinsey & Company says Europe may be on the cusp of a transformation in defence innovation akin to the Manhattan Project - the scientific push that saw the US rapidly develop nuclear weapons during World War Two.

title: "Government Choosing Voters": Tejashwi Yadav On Bihar Voter List Revision
content: Political temperatures in Bihar are soaring as Leader of Opposition Tejashwi Yadav launched a scathing attack on the Election Commission and the NDA government.

title: Ahmedabad-Diu IndiGo Flight Aborts Take-Off Due To Technical Snag
content: A Diu-bound IndiGo flight from Ahmedabad carrying around 50 passengers and crew members aborted take-off at the last minute on Wednesday due to a technical issue, sources said.

title: Can Opposition Boycott Bihar Elections? Tejashwi Yadav Says "May Discuss"
content: Rashtriya Janata Dal's Tejashwi Yadav has alleged that the Election Commission is taking its orders from the ruling BJP and in such circumstances, holding an election in Bihar has become meaningless.

title: 1 Lakh Voters "Untraceable" In Bihar, Says Poll Body Amid Voter Roll Revision
content: The Election Commission on Wednesday said 1 lakh electors remain "untraceable" in the ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in Bihar while enumeration forms of 7.17 crore have been received and digitised.

title: 3 Bengaluru Riots Case Convicts Jailed In Huge Win For Anti-Terror Agency
content: In a major development in the 2020 Bengaluru riots case, a special NIA court has sentenced three accused to seven years of rigorous imprisonment after they pleaded guilty during the charge-framing stage.

title: Only 4 Of 16 Vice Presidential Elections Were Won Without A Contest
content: Only four of the 16 elections for the post of the vice president of India have been won without a contest, while two elections witnessed a multi-cornered fight.

title: Detonators In A Plastic Bag Found Outside Toilet At Bengaluru Bus Stand
content: Six gelatin sticks, which are the latest form of dynamites, and some detonators, were found in a plastic carry bag near a toilet at a government bus stand in Bengaluru on Wednesday, sparking security concerns.

title: Tripura BJP's Key Ally Seeks Revision Of Voter Rolls In State
content: The ruling BJP's key ally in Tripura, Tipra Motha Party (TMP), on Wednesday met the Election Commission of India to press for its demand for a Special Intensive Revision (SIR), an exercise like the one in Bihar, in the northeastern state.

title: Narendra Modi UK Visit LIVE: PM Modi Leaves For 2-Day UK Visit, Trade Agreement, Khalistanis On Agenda
content: PM Narendra Modi UK and Maldives Visit LIVE Updates: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to start his four-day visit to the United Kingdom and the Maldives on Wednesday.

title: "Father-In-Law Hugged Me": Woman Sets Herself Ablaze, Alleges Harassment
content: A 32-year-old woman from Tamil Nadu's Ramanathapuram district has died after setting herself on fire, allegedly in protest against sustained sexual harassment by her father-in-law and years of dowry-related abuse by her in-laws.

title: Opinion: Opinion | UK-India Trade Pact: The Empire, Finally, Shakes An Equal Hand
content: For 200 years, Britain shaped India's trade rules to its advantage - plundering raw materials, taxing salt, killing industries in the name of "free markets". Now, as post-Brexit UK shops around for friends, India has become a prized dance partner.

title: Parliament Costs 2.5 Lakh Per Minute To Run. 3 Days Already Lost This Session
content: The Monsoon session of Parliament has, as expected, been a stormy one, but behind the headlines about repeated adjournments lies a real cost - Rs 2.5 lakh for every minute the Parliament is in session during active hours.

title: Inspired By Crime Shows, Border Force Jawan Robs Delhi Jewellery Shop Using Toy Gun
content: A BSF constable, who joined the force a month ago, was arrested for robbing a Delhi jewellery store with a toy gun in broad daylight, after allegedly getting inspired by crime shows following losses in online gambling, an official said on Wednesday.

title: 2 Killed, 2 Injured In Northern Ireland Shooting
content: A shooting in a rural area of Northern Ireland left two people dead and two others seriously wounded, police said Wednesday.

title: Navi Mumbai Man, Obsessed With Married Woman, Kills Her Husband
content: Women killing their husbands has been making headlines recently, and so have spurned lovers who have murdered people for rejecting them. In Navi Mumbai, however, a spurned lover killed a woman's husband and dumped the body in a creek.

title: Mizoram's Oldest Woman, Famiangi, Dies At 117
content: Famiangi, believed to be the oldest woman in all of northeastern states, died at the age of 117 on Tuesday morning at her home in Mizoram's Pangkhua village in southern Lawngtlai district.

title: Video: Army Deploys Chopper To Rescue Boy Trapped In Flood In J&K's Rajouri
content: In a high-risk rescue operation, the Indian Army, along with the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF), local police, and civilian divers, successfully rescued a minor boy who was trapped in the middle of a flooded river in Rajouri.

title: 4 Al-Qaeda Terrorists Arrested In Gujarat, They Used Auto-Delete App
content: Four terrorists linked to al-Qaeda involved in running a fake currency racket and spreading the global terror group's ideology have been arrested by the Gujarat anti-terrorist squad (ATS). One of them was arrested from another state, the ATS said.

title: AI-171 crash: 'Mortal remains handled with utmost professionalism,' says MEA on 'wrong bodies' claim

title: Caitlin Clark gives Iowa hoops special shipment of her player edition sneaker
content: WNBA star caitlin Clark surprised the Iowa Hawkeyes men's and women's basketball teams . she has consistently sported the Kobe Bryant signature shoe since her college days at Iowa . "it's not eve," she said last season .

title: One month until college football: Swing games for every Top 25 team
content: a month away from college football, we asked our reporters to single out one contest for each of our post-spring Top 25 teams that could swing their season one way or the other . some will come in major nonconference battles over the first couple of weeks, some are more traditional league games that could set the tone for the things to come .

title: Zubimendi joined Arsenal after rejecting Liverpool. Can he end their title wait?
content: arsenal manager Mikel Arteta believes new signing Martn Zubimendi joins the club . the club's away kit launch on Monday took place at NOVA Rooftop in Singapore . it is the only tangible improvement they can make after three consecutive second-place finishes in the premier league .

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool, Spurs enter Rodrygo race
content: real madrid are interested in signing manchester city midfielder Rodri . despite his recent long-term injury, the 29-year-old has recovered from a serious knee injury . the spaniard is set to enter the final year of his contract in 2026 .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 training camps: Chiefs see instant Mahomes-Rice connection
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL . our 32 team reporters are on the ground each day following all the action . we have updated depth charts for all 32 teams . ari | ATL | BAL | BUF | CAR | CHI | CIN CLE | DAL | DEN | DET | GB | HOU | IND .

title: MLS All-Star Game history: All-time matchups, MVPs, stats
content: the MLS All-Star Game has become a favorite annual showcase for soccer fans . each year, a group of players will face off against an international club or another league . MLS is 10-10 against international competition in the game's history .
